intro: Pterocymbium splendens, commonly known as the golden pterocymbium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow and green foliage and produces showy, fragrant flowers with intricate patterns. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
